00018 #ifndef __TLM_DMI_H__
00019 #define __TLM_DMI_H__
00020 
00021 #include <systemc>
00022 
00023 // TODO: review, TLM_LITTLE_ENDIAN is defined there:
00024 #include "tlm_h/tlm_generic_payload/tlm_helpers.h"
00025 
00026 namespace tlm {
00027 
00028 class tlm_dmi
00029 {
00030 public:
00031 
00032   tlm_dmi()
00033   {
00034     init();
00035   }
00036   
00037   void init()
00038   {
00039     dmi_ptr           = 0;
00040     dmi_start_address = 0x0;
00041     dmi_end_address   = (sc_dt::uint64)-1;
00042     type              = READ_WRITE;
00043     read_latency      = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00044     write_latency     = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00045     endianness        = TLM_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00046   }
00047   
00048   // If the forward call is successful, the target returns the dmi_ptr,
00049   // which must point to the data element corresponding to the
00050   // dmi_start_address. The data is organized as a byte array with the
00051   // endianness of the target (endianness member of the tlm_dmi struct).
00052   unsigned char* dmi_ptr;
00053   
00054   // The absolute start and end addresses of the DMI region. If the decoder
00055   // logic in the interconnect changes the address field e.g. by masking, the
00056   // interconnect is responsible to transform the relative address back to an
00057   // absolute address again.
00058   sc_dt::uint64 dmi_start_address;
00059   sc_dt::uint64 dmi_end_address;
00060 
00061   // The type accesses this DMI range support. If the 'for_reads' parameter
00062   // of the 'get_direct_mem_ptr' call is set to true, a target must set this
00063   // attribute to READ (in case the range is only for read accesses) or
00064   // READ_WRITE (in case the range supports both read and write accesses). If
00065   // the 'for_reads' parameter is false a target must set this to WRITE or
00066   // READ_WRITE.
00067   enum Type { READ = 0x1, WRITE = 0x2, READ_WRITE = READ|WRITE };
00068   Type type;
00069     
00070   // These members define the latency of read/write transactions. The
00071   // initiator must initialize these members to zero before requesting a
00072   // dmi pointer, because both the interconnect as well as the target can
00073   // add to the total transaction latency.
00074   // Depending on the 'type' attribute only one, or both of these attributes
00075   // will be valid.
00076   sc_core::sc_time  read_latency;
00077   sc_core::sc_time  write_latency;
00078   
00079   // The target sets the endianness of the data in the dmi_ptr array.
00080   tlm_endianness endianness;
00081 };
00082 
00083 } // namespace tlm
00084 
00085 #endif /* TLM_DMI_HEADER */
